definition.name: Rebase Pulls
definition.description: Rebase pull requests in a repository

inputs.name: head
inputs.description: Filter pull requests by head user or head organization and branch name in the format user:ref-name or organization:ref-name. For example: github:new-script-format or octocat:test-branch.

inputs.name: base
inputs.description: Filter pull requests by base branch name. Example: gh-pages.

inputs.name: include-labels
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of pull request labels to include. Allows any labels if unspecified.

inputs.name: exclude-labels
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of pull request labels to exclude

inputs.name: rebase-options
inputs.description: A comma or newline separated list of options to pass to the git rebase command. For example, `-Xtheirs`.

evidence.reasoning: The action is primarily focused on improving the quality of code by rebasing pull requests, which is a common practice in code review processes. It also involves communication aspects as it interacts with pull requests in a repository.
